summary.para: Called by the registered application's handler to delete a previously logged ErrorInformation, warning, or error message in the error tab on the synchronization manager status dialog box.

param.name: ErrorID
param.para: The LogError to be deleted. If ErrorID is GUID_NULL all errors logged by the instance of the registered application's handler will be deleted.

returns.para: This method supports the standard return values E_INVALIDARG, E_UNEXPECTED, and E_OUTOFMEMORY, as well as the following:

description.para: The item was successfully deleted from the log.

summary.para: Called by the registered application before and after any dialog boxes are displayed from within the and methods.

param.name: fEnable
param.para: TRUE if the registered application is requesting permission to display a dialog box or FALSE if the registered application has finished displaying a dialog box.

returns.para: This method can return one of these values.

description.para: The dialog box should not be displayed.

remarks.para: To request permission to display a dialog box, the registered application first calls ISyncMgrSynchronizeCallback.EnableModeless with fEnable set to TRUE. If S_OK is returned, the registered application may display the dialog box. Once the dialog box has been displayed, the registered application must call ISyncMgrSynchronizeCallback.EnableModeless with fEnable set to FALSE to notify SyncMgr that other items may now display user interface elements.

summary.para: Called by the registered application's handler when a network connection is required.

param.name: pwszConnection
param.para: The name of the connection to dial.

returns.para: This method supports the standard return values E_INVALIDARG, E_UNEXPECTED, and E_OUTOFMEMORY, as well as the following:

remarks.para: SyncMgr should use the default autodial connection if pwszConnection is NULL.

When an instance of EstablishConnection is called by a handler, SyncMgr tries to establish the connection. If a subsequent EstablishConnection is called then SyncMgr attempts the new connection without causing the previous connection to stop responding. All connections remain until all handlers have finished synchronizing. After all handlers have synchronized, then any opened connections are closed by SyncMgr.

summary.para: Called by a registered application to log information, warning, or an error message into the error tab on the synchronization manager status dialog box.

param.name: dwErrorLevel
param.para: The error level. Values are taken from the enumeration.

param.name: pszErrorText
param.para: A pointer to error text to be displayed in the error tab.

param.name: pSyncLogError
param.para: A pointer to the structure that contains additional error information. Registered applications that do not provide this data can pass NULL.

returns.para: This method supports the standard return values E_INVALIDARG, E_UNEXPECTED, and E_OUTOFMEMORY, and the following:

description.para: The error information is logged successfully.

summary.para: Called by a registered handler of an application after the method is complete.

param.name: hr
param.para: The return value of the method. If S_OK is returned, the synchronization manager calls for the item. If the HRESULT is set to anything other than S_OK, the synchronization manager releases the handler without calling the Synchronize method.

returns.para: This method can return one of these values.

remarks.para: A registered handler of an application should return as soon as possible from the method, and then call this method to notify the synchronization manager that the registered application is preparing for synchronization.
It is acceptable for the registered handler of an application to call this method before returning from the method.
The registered handler of an application should not call this method if the method returns any value that is different from S_OK.

summary.para: Called by a registered application to update the progress information and determine whether an operation should continue.

param.name: ItemID
param.para: A reference to the item identifier for an item that is being updated.

param.name: pSyncProgressItem
param.para: A pointer to a structure that contains the updated progress information.

returns.para: This method can return one of these values.

description.para: Cancels the synchronization on a specified item, as soon as possible.
Cancels the synchronization on all items that are associated with this application, as soon as possible.

remarks.para: Registered applications should call this method to provide normal feedback even when the flag is set.

summary.para: Called by the registered application's handler before or after its operation has been completed.

param.name: hr
param.para: Whether was successful. This value is S_SYNCMGR_RETRYSYNC if the registered application's handler requires SyncMgr to retry the synchronization. When this value is returned to SyncMgr both the and methods are called again.

param.name: cItems
param.para: The number of items in the array pointed to by the pItemIDs parameter. This parameter is ignored unless hrResult is S_SYNCMGR_RETRYSYNC.

param.name: pItemIDs
param.para: A pointer to the array of item IDs to pass to in the event of a retry. This parameter is ignored unless hrResult is S_SYNCMGR_RETRYSYNC.

returns.para: This method can return one of these values.

remarks.para: The pItemIDs parameter is an [in] parameter and the calling function owns the memory pointed to by it. SyncMgr makes a copy of the array before returning.
The registered application's handler should return from the method as soon as possible and then call this method to notify SyncMgr that it has completed processing the ShowError call.
It is acceptable for the registered application's handler to call this method before returning from the method.
The registered application's handler should not call this method unless a success code is returned from the method.

summary.para: Called by the registered application's handler before or after its operation is completed.

returns.para: This method can return one of these values.

remarks.para: It is acceptable for the registered application's handler to call this method before returning from the method.
This method should not be called if the registered application's handler does not return a success code from the method.

summary.para: Called by an application when its method is complete.

param.name: hr
param.para: The returned result from the method.

returns.para: This method can return one of these values.

remarks.para: A registered handler of an application should return from the method as soon as possible, and then call this method to notify the synchronization manager that the synchronization process is complete.
It is acceptable for a registered handler of an application to call this method before returning from the method.
However, the registered handler of an application should not call this method if the method returns any value that is different from S_OK.

summary.para: Exposes methods that manage the synchronization process.

remarks.para: This interface is implemented by the synchronization manager to receive status, error, and progress information and display the user interface during the synchronization process.
Applications should call the methods of this interface as often as possible and must call it before starting each new ItemID to check whether the user has canceled an individual item.
